title: Task-Centered Instructional Design Based on the 4C/ID Model for Integrated Language·Science·Technology Education (ILS&T)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic educational methodologies and general understanding of science/technology education
context.additional_context: Learners experience ILS&T (Integrated Learning, Simulation, and Training) lesson design by utilizing the four components of the 4C/ID model (learning tasks, supportive information, procedural information, part-task practice) in online (theory) and offline (practice/collaboration) environments.

learning_goals: Learners can apply the four components of the 4C/ID model to actual ILS&T lesson design
Learners can independently design integrated learning tasks combining language, science, and technology elements
Learners can distinguish and explain the differences between supportive and procedural information provided to learners
Learners can collaborate with partners to develop and implement part-task training plans
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
